Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to number names and representations of number
Elaboration: Responding to the use of number names and numerals in stories, songs and music; for example, showing interest when listening to counting in books or interacting with numbers and quantities of objects in sensory tubs

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to number names and representations of number
Elaboration: Touching or feeling objects as they are being counted; for example, touching objects as they are lined up in order or touching tactile (sandpaper) numbers while they are being named

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to number names and representations of number
Elaboration: Participating in movement activities such as counting when walking up steps, walking over sensory pads or moving fingers while they are being counted

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to changing collections of objects
Elaboration: Tracking groups of objects; for example, following an object or group of objects with their eyes or through gesture

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to changing collections of objects
Elaboration: Responding to significant disparity in collections of motivational objects; for example, vocalising excitement when shown 20 cars compared to 1 car or when motivational items are covered to represent ‘all gone’

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to changing collections of objects
Elaboration: Vocalising or gesturing when objects appear; for example, making a noise when shown a preferred object, reaching towards a group of their favourite items when presented, or vocalising or gesturing when playing peekaboo and a face appears

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to changing collections of objects
Elaboration: Vocalising or gesturing when familiar objects are taken away; for example, gesturing towards a sensory object when it is taken away or when a familiar person leaves a space

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to counting, comparing and labelling of collections
Elaboration: Responding to the use of number names and number sequences in everyday routines and activities; for example, participating in counting the number of classmates at school, or vocalising or gesturing when objects are counted as they are being packed away

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to counting, comparing and labelling of collections
Elaboration: Participating in modelled rote counting through songs, stories and activities; for example, participating in role-playing in the song ‘Ten little monkeys jumping on the bed’ or ‘Five little ducks’, or experiencing modelled counting when being pushed on the swing

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to counting, comparing and labelling of collections
Elaboration: Participating in modelled counting, using one-to-one correspondence; for example, touching each cup of flour as it is added into a bowl or touching each pompom as it is counted in a line

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to practical situations involving addition and subtraction of collections with physical and virtual materials
Elaboration: Responding to a familiar object being removed or added from a collection; for example, using gestures or vocalisations to indicate a change when the adult says ‘all gone’, ‘no more left’, ‘another one’, ‘give me more’ or ‘finished’

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to practical situations involving addition and subtraction of collections with physical and virtual materials
Elaboration: Participating in objects or groups of objects being subtracted from a collection to make none; for example, putting away all the pencils to leave none or posting letters in a letterbox until there are none left

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to practical situations involving addition and subtraction of collections with physical and virtual materials
Elaboration: Participating in objects or groups of objects being added to a collection; for example, adding 3 flowers to a vase with 2 flowers

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to practical situations involving addition and subtraction of collections with physical and virtual materials
Elaboration: Assisting in adding or taking away one object from a collection; for example, touching or gesturing at the object that will be removed

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to practical situations involving addition and subtraction of collections with physical and virtual materials
Elaboration: Participating in situations that involve simple money transactions; for example, using a group of one-dollar coins or notes to ‘pay’ for physical items

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to sharing objects or a collection equally, in practical situations
Elaboration: Participating in objects being equally distributed and shared; for example, assisting to distribute objects while an adult uses modelled phrases such as ‘one each’, ‘two for everyone’ or ‘one for you and one for me’

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to sharing objects or a collection equally, in practical situations
Elaboration: Assisting in distributing objects to or sharing objects with others in everyday situations; for example, handing out a writing implement to each student from a collection of writing implements or sharing muffins with each class member after a cooking lesson

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to sharing objects or a collection equally, in practical situations
Elaboration: Participating in the modelled partitioning or combining of collections of objects; for example, vocalising or gesturing as the teacher partitions counters using a ten-frame while saying ‘We have 6 counters altogether: there are 4 in this group and 2 in that group’

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to actions that have an effect
Elaboration: Participating in using objects that generate an immediate effect upon an action; for example, using musical instruments, touch-sensitive lights, crinkly materials, pull-and-push toys, and adapted switch toys or appliances

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to actions that have an effect
Elaboration: Experiencing a repeating pattern on textured material; for example, rolling over a series of bumps or feeling a repeating pattern on objects with different textures

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to actions that have an effect
Elaboration: Using an instrument such as a drum or triangle to make a repeating sound

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to actions that have an effect
Elaboration: Participating in mark-making; for example, making lines or dots using paint, marker pens or a digital device

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to routine and non-routine events during the school day
Elaboration: Responding to a routine or non-routine event by demonstrating a change in body language or facial expression or through vocalisation; for example, looking towards their lunchbox when brought out during mealtime, or responding to a change or disruption to a daily routine or event such as a wet-weather timetable or an incursion

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to routine and non-routine events during the school day
Elaboration: Participating in everyday events and their associated visual, equipment and sensory elements; for example, indicating a preference for a known activity through vocalisation or gesture, or looking towards a lunchbox when paired with a symbol, object and single word in response to the teacher saying ‘lunchtime’

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to routine and non-routine events during the school day
Elaboration: Responding to routine school events; for example, gesturing or vocalising in response to teacher statements such as ‘Today is Monday. We have swimming after lunch’ or ‘It is recess. Get your morning tea’, or looking at the ‘then’ item on a ‘first-then’ board

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to shapes and objects in their environment
Elaboration: Participating in exploring shapes and objects; for example, feeling the curved edge of a circle compared to the straight edges of a rectangle, tracing the outline of the shapes

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to shapes and objects in their environment
Elaboration: Responding to the naming of different two-dimensional shapes; for example, looking at the corresponding object or picture symbol when it is named

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to shapes and objects in their environment
Elaboration: Assisting in sorting shapes and objects by a single attribute; for example, gazing or gesturing when objects are sorted by colour or shape

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to shapes and objects in their environment
Elaboration: Responding to objects that indicate routine activities; for example, vocalising when presented with a hat to be worn outside for playtime

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to movement of objects, people or self within a familiar space
Elaboration: Participating in activities where there is a change of location or position; for example, exploring the concepts of ‘inside’ and ‘outside’ during structured activities

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to movement of objects, people or self within a familiar space
Elaboration: Responding when participating in activities where there is a change of movement or body position; for example, vocalising when they move towards or away from an object

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to movement of objects, people or self within a familiar space
Elaboration: Responding when participating in changes of location of objects or their body position; for example, responding to directions, statements or questions from familiar people (‘Arms up’, ‘I am moving your bag’, ‘Where did it go?’) or when they move from one place to another

Subject: Mathematics
ContentDescription_V2: Respond to movement of objects, people or self within a familiar space
Elaboration: Gesturing at, reaching for or looking for a desired object by moving their head or body for a better view; for example, tilting their head towards a preferred object
